poem:
Title: "On the Garrick's Gate"

Against the Garrick's staunch and stone gate,
Inequality, like an old crow, perches,
Bloody gaze on the heart of the arts.
Simmering in their silk, men of notes hold sway,
Blind to the storm of change at play.
Yet, come the gale of equality's might,
Even stoic doors must learn to invite
Both wealth of mind and woman's right.
